alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Stillwater (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 06 at 4:35PM MDT until June 06 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Billings has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Carbon County in south central Montana... Northeastern Stillwater County in south central Montana... * Until 1030 PM MDT. * At 435 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Radar estimates between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, and other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Rural roads may become impassable. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Columbus, Joliet, Boyd, Park City, Cooney Reservoir State Park, Halfbreed Lake Wildlife, Rapelje, Hailstone Wildlife Refuge, Roberts, Rockvale and Silesia. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
